bow: stay at home moms raise your hand if you do want to play with your kids all day long from the moment wake up get moooooom play with me would rather do anything else let read let color let does have anyone else to play with on day to day basis just not good at pretend feel ya feel the same most of the time am so over it but also feel really guilty at the same time yes me too feel like bad mom since always try to get out of it congratulations on the upcoming baby ah yeah that is harder since she has no one else you can pawn her off on 🙋🙋🙋🤦 can do the imaginative play dolls cars dress up etc have no idea why but can stand it so usually turn down the play requests but offer to take them to the park swimming go to friends etc straight up tell them your brain is made to play that how you grow and learn my brain is no longer that way so it just not the same fun for me ll do it for bit and then let do that everyone likes my kids are always on top of me it feels like pretty sure say goooo play 3million times day feel less bad because his dad is more than happy to do this when he gets home and all weekend take my son to music classes story times play dates indoor playground normal playgrounds we clean together we bake together etc at the end of the day he alive fed bathed socialized and the apartment is clean ve actually been terrible at reading lately pretty much one book day so tell my husband and he makes sure to get extra reading in while they hang out he is an only child though so feel like my energy goes towards going to those social activities which require planning getting him ready amp packing this somehow takes more time amp mental energy than would have ever though before had child thank god it is just me do mind being in the room while they play but actually playing really struggle with either am just bored out of my skull or my oldest is just too bossy about how people play with him for it to be enjoyable amp x200b have finally gotten my boys happy to have me in the room while knit read wake up and they play 🙋🏻‍♀️ the only things regularly do is play with legos and magnatiles the pretend stuff ll be the patient for him playing doctor and just lay there and that it however summer is coming and he wants to basically live in the pool and am totally good with that depends on time sleep quantity minutes after getting up hell no the key is to find easy extended play my little guy loves parking his cars all 200+ in nice little lines or running them down cardboard tubes and then parking them we can do this for an hour and just have to throw in suggestion every now and then learnt this from my other half who can play and watch tv we do loads of other stuff so some down time watching nature or history documentaries for me while we play cars is the best my five year old has never been good at entertaining himself lately he and his year old sister have been playing so well together it amazing life changing stuff it because somewhere deep down you remember what it should feel like to play pretend it the difference between magical adventure and just moving pieces of plastic around it feels wrong because we can do it right anymore or maybe it just me but every time try feel just like when stopped finding my toys fun as kid remember trying to make the game come alive again but it just wasn the same you re not alone so bad at role playing stuff and do enjoy it my daughter is so much more imaginative and creative than me it lot more fun when she and my husband play together don play much will happily watch or listen to them tell me what they are doing as they act out whatever storyline they come up with more the let go explore the woods color do craft or bake parent good with that that why there two of son was little and it had been few years since played an rpg still have harder time coming up with the ideas out of the blue but the kids take care of that part and it easier to let my imagination and blow off steam as well ve been to several parenting classes because you can never have too much information on how to be parent there book the incredible years trouble shooting guide for parents of children aged years by carolyn webster stratton that addresses this specifically they suggest setting aside one on one time with your children where you do one thing with them few times week for 15 20 minutes like building castle with blocks drawing pictures whatever it is they want to do you just tell them this is our time we re going to do this one thing that you want to do for the next 20 minutes and when your time is up then that it for today the book explains it way better but it just gives them that time they need with you doing the one thing that they want to do where you can encourage their growth and just be with them for set time that what would do and at first was very hesitant but after they got into the groove of knowing they were going to get 20 minutes of them time the constant play with me all the time stuff stopped for the most part there is also another book parenting with love and logic by foster cline that really helped me deal with the tantrums my son
